intro: Antennaria fallax, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its fine, hairy leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its scientific name reflects its distinctive, mouse-like appearance, with its hairy stems and clustered flowers. Antennaria fallax is well adapted to cold climates and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
